page.title: 17PETERSFIELD - HOUSING
page.content: {Private houses}have been built along the A3 known locally as the{Causeway for over a mile and similarly along {Sussex Road}to beyond the Heath Lake. Houses built along Sussex Road close to the town are old but most of the Causeway and by the Lake were built pre 1939. The majority of the houses form a post war estate west of the A3, bounded by{Cranford Road and Grange {Road.}Private houses form the eastern end of Cranford Road, the rest were built as council houses although a large proportion have now been bought by the occupiers. A new private estate has been built south of Cranford Road near the railway line and its road pattern suggests that it will be extended in the future. Larger proper- ties overlook the Heath Lake and some infilling has taken place in an old house's grounds to form{Russell Way.}
